author: Paul Dann
message: Thank you for your work on Colibri; it's really appreciated!

author: Rsh
message: Wow, original notifications are so useless - this sounds very good! Is there some openSUSE repo with it?

author: Anon
message:
Seems interesting, thanks.

What kind of KDE notifications is this supposed to replace ?
The ones that are draggable and can snap to borders (and that are buggy as hell).
Or the ones that are attached to the systray and have a swipe effect ?

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message: Any kind of notification using freedesktop.org's notification protocol.

replies.author: Anon
replies.message:
OK...
I guess I have to test and see for myself then :p

replies.author: Anon
replies.message: Replying to myself : This replaces the swiping/interactive notifications of KDE 4.10 too :)

author: Blablabla
message: I'm currently using a fork of Colibri called 'colibri-interactive' (https://github.com/JimiSmit... seems that the author, 'JimmiSmith', deleted that project from his GitHub repo) because he added interactive notifications as an option. And is wonderful. Would be very great if you include that in upstream...

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Wow. Never heard about this project. Would have loved to look at the code, do you have it somewhere?

replies.message: Oops! Sorry for being so late. I have a copy of the branch, if you want I can send it to you so you can take a look. Or maybe you can contact the developer directly, https://github.com/JimiSmith/ and ask him about that and "why the hell he deleted that project!"

author: Cédric
message: Thanks Aurelien, original notifications are unusable IMO (and make plasma crash in last KDE versions). This is just perfect, Ayatana notifications just rulez! (in Unity too)

author: Tobias
message:
Thank you so much for colibri. It is the first thing I install on a
fresh system (the second would be plasma-menubar, isn't that also from
you?), the default notifications are to distractive for me. Remarkable that it wasn't updated for two years, it worked always
like a charm. In fact I didn't notice that the shadows were missing
until I read your blog entry ;-)

replies.author: Tobias
replies.message: One quick note: Is it possible to disable notifications when an application is running in full screen mode (like a video playing or a game)? This sometimes can be distracting.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: It is not possible to disable notifications for applications running in fullscreen mode for now. Implementing this would be a bit tricky because one would still want some of the notifications to appear, even in fullscreen, for example the "you are running out of battery" notification.
